meanings.definition: To become familiar with someone or something again.
meanings.sent1: After years apart, they reacquainted at the high school reunion.
meanings.sent2: I reacquainted myself with the old neighborhood during my visit.
meanings.sent3: The cat reacquainted itself with the lost toy, thinking it was a new discovery.
meanings.sent4: As the sun rose, the town reacquainted itself with the warmth of daylight.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh cookies baking in the oven reacquainted me with childhood memories.

meanings.definition: To renew a previous acquaintance or familiarity.
meanings.sent1: She reacquainted with her childhood friend after many years.
meanings.sent2: The book club members reacquainted at the monthly meeting.
meanings.sent3: The old car reacquainted with the road, feeling the familiar bumps and turns.
meanings.sent4: The artist reacquainted with their favorite paintbrush, ready to create again.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh coffee in the morning reacquainted him with the start of a new day.
